name: Tasmania
hint: Australia's island state, separated from the mainland by Bass Strait

name: New Guinea
hint: Second-largest island in the world, divided between Papua New Guinea and Indonesia

name: North Island
hint: One of New Zealand's two main islands, home to Auckland and Wellington

name: South Island
hint: Larger of New Zealand's two main islands, home to the Southern Alps and Fiordland

name: Bougainville
hint: Largest island in the autonomous region of Papua New Guinea, in the Solomon Sea

name: Viti Levu
hint: Largest island of Fiji, where the capital Suva and tourism hub Nadi are located

name: New Caledonia
hint: French territory in the southwest Pacific, known for its vast lagoon and nickel mining

name: Tahiti
hint: Largest island in French Polynesia, famous for black pearls and overwater bungalows

name: Guadalcanal
hint: Largest island of the Solomon Islands, site of a pivotal World War II battle

name: Kangaroo Island
hint: Third-largest island in Australia, off the coast of South Australia, a wildlife sanctuary

name: Fiji Islands
hint: Archipelago of over 330 islands in the South Pacific, famous for coral reefs and clear lagoons

name: Samoa
hint: Polynesian island nation known as the 'Cradle of Polynesia', home of Robert Louis Stevenson

name: Tonga
hint: Polynesian kingdom of 169 islands, the last monarchy in the Pacific

name: Fraser Island
hint: World's largest sand island, off the Queensland coast, with freshwater lakes and dingo populations

name: Stewart Island
hint: New Zealand's third-largest island, south of the South Island, great for spotting kiwi birds in the wild
